column11: 'dried shrimps;Nyonya Sambal chilly;fine sugar;lime leaves'
column12: '300g dried shrimps; 2 tablespoons Nonya Sambal chilly; 1 teaspoon fine sugar; 2 kaffir lime leaves'
column13: '1. Heat oven to 150°C. ;2. Rinse dried shrimp. Dry with paper towels. ;3. Put dried shrimp into a food processor. Blitz until coarsely chopped. ;4. Place on oven tray, sprayed first with oil and add sambal chilly (and sugar, if using). Using a spoon, rub sambal well in till evenly mixed; the even red colour will indicate that the mixing has been done. ;5. Roast mixture in the oven for about 15 minutes or till golden brown. Scatter kaffir lime leaves at the end. Stir in and leave in the oven with the heat turned off for a few more minutes. ;6. Remove tray from the oven and cool. ;7. Place cooled dried shrimp into sterilised bottles. '

column11: 'vegetarian chicken;cooking oil;glutinous rice;blue pea flower;hemp string;pandan leaves;salt;dried bamboo leaves;biryani powder;water;mushroom stock;brown sugar;winter melon;dried chilly;lemongrass;blue ginger;turmeric'
column12: '350g vegetarian chicken;125ml cooking oil;500g glutinous rice;15 stalks blue pea flower;5 meters hemp string;8 pandan leaves;0.5 teaspoons of salt;36 pcs dried bamboo leaves;2 tablespoons or 12g biryani powder;2 tablespoons water;2 teaspoons mushroom stock;50g brown sugar;50g winter melon;15 stalks dried chilly;45g 2 stalks of fresh lemongrass;15g fresh blue ginger;15g fresh turmeric'
column13: '1. Rinse the rice and then soak 350g in clear water for 3 hours. ;2. Pound the blue pea flower to extract the colour and add it to the rest of the rice. Soak for 3 hours. ;3. An hour in, soak the dried bamboo leaves in a separate container and then wash them clean. ;4. To prepare filling, chop the mock chicken meat — coarsely or cubed to your preference. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil and saute for approximately 30 seconds, then remove from wok. ;5. Finely ground the spice paste and mix the biryani powder with 2 tablespoons of water to make another paste. Heat the rest of the oil and saute the spice paste until fragrant. Then add in the biryani paste and saute for 30 seconds. ;6. Add to the paste mixture the mushroom powder, brown sugar, winter melon and mix in chicken meat. Turn off the heat and set aside to cool. ;7. To wrap the dumplings: take two washed bamboo leaves and fold one end to form a cone. ;8. Line the cone with about 1 tablespoon of the blue glutinous rice and top with some plain glutinous rice, spreading it out evenly to the shape of the cone. ;9. Place 2 heaped tablespoons of filling in the rice before covering the filling with more rice. ;10. Top the rice with a pandan leaf, and then using the palm of your free hand, press down to compress the dumpling. ;11. Wrap the dumpling up following the natural lines of the leaves. Make sure there are no holes. ;12. Tie tightly with the hemp string and repeat until all dumplings are tied. The first one usually looks the ugliest — it does get better. ;13. Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add salt and leave the dumplings in rapidly boiling water for 2–21/4 hours. ;14. Once cooked, hang dumplings to drip off excess water before storing or eating. '

column11: 'yellow capsicums;cooked rice;French beans;canned corn kernels;tomato;extra virgin olive oil; Salt;pepper;coriander;shredded cheese'
column12: '4 large yellow capsicums; 2 cups cooked rice; 80g French beans; 100g canned corn kernels; 1 large tomato; 4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil; 0.5 teaspoon of salt; 0.5 teaspoon of pepper; 10g coriander; 100g shredded cheese'
column13: '1. Preheat the oven to 180°C. Blanch the French beans in slightly salted boiling water for 30 seconds before draining and dicing. In a large mixing bowl, add the rice, diced French beans, corn kernels, diced tomato, olive oil, coriander and stir to combine. Add salt and pepper to taste. ;2. Carefully slice the top of the yellow capsicums off and reserve the tops as garnishes. With your fingers, remove most of the seeds and white membrane in the core of the capsicums. Tap out all any remaining seeds. ;3. Stuff each capsicum with the rice salad. Top off with the shredded cheese if desired. ;4. Top off with the shredded cheese if desired. ;5. Bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes until the capsicum turns slightly soft or when the cheese starts browning.'

column11: 'chicken;meat curry powder;chilly powder;cooking oil;potato;water;curry leaf;coconut milk;tamarind peel;salt2 stalks lemon grass;cinnamon stick;anise;cardamon;shallots;garlic;ginger'
column12: '750g chicken;2 tablespoons meat curry powder;2 heaped teaspoons chilly powder;2 tablespoons cooking oil;2 potatoes;500ml water1 spring curry leaf;250ml coconut milk;1 piece tamarind peel;2 teaspoons of salt;2 stalks lemon grass;1.5cm cinnamon stick;1 star anise;2 cardamons;3 shallots;1 clove garlic;5g young ginger'
column13: '1. Marinate chicken with curry powder, chilly powder and salt. Set aside for 30 minutes in the refrigerator. ;2. Heat oil, add in bruised lemon grass and spice ingredients until oil sizzles (about 10 seconds). ;3. Add in ground ingredients and stir fry till fragrant, stirring continuously to prevent the ingredients from burning. ;4. Add in chicken, sauté further until fragrant (about 5-10 minutes). ;5. Add water, potatoes and curry leaves. ;6. Simmer over medium heat until chicken is tender and potatoes are soft. ;7. Add in coconut milk, tamarind peel, bring to a boil and season to taste. ;8. Turn off heat and serve with steamed white rice. '

column11: 'small prawn;garlic;White cabbage;green bean;leeks;carrot;Chinese mushrooms;light soy sauce;salt;Pepper;sugar;Popiah skin;Chinese lettuce;Chinese sausages;egg;cucumber;bean sprout;coriander;Fried garlic;roasted peanuts;Sweet black soy sauce;garlic paste;red chilly'
column12: '500g small prawns; 4 tablespoons garlic; 1 White cabbage; 2 cups green beans; 5 stalks leeks; 2 carrots; 10 Chinese mushrooms; 2 tablespoons light soy sauce; 1 teaspoon salt; Pepper; 1 tablespoon sugar;1kg Popiah skins; 5 heads Chinese lettuce; 4 Chinese sausages; 6 eggs; 2 cucumbers; 500g bean sprouts; 5 bunches fresh coriander; 100g Fried garlic; 1 cup roasted peanuts; 0.5 teaspoon of sweet black soy sauce; 0.5 teaspoon of Fresh garlic paste; 20 red chilly'
column13: '1. Peel prawns and reserve meat. Place shells in a pot, cover with water and boil for 30 minutes to make prawn stock. Strain stock and leave aside. ;2. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large wok and sauté garlic till fragrant. ;3. Add the mushrooms and carrots, followed by shredded cabbage, green beans and leeks. ;4. Mix well, then add the reserved prawn and mushroom stocks, then the peeled prawns. ;5. Braise, turning often to prevent burning, till vegetables soften. ;6. Season with the salt, pepper, soy sauce. Taste and adjust if needed. Add sugar, if liked. ;7. To assemble: Place one flour skin on a plate. Spread a little garlic paste, sweet soy sauce and chilly on one side of the skin. ;8. Lay a lettuce leaf in the centre. Place a spoonful or two of the filling, squeezed dry of gravy. ;9. Top with sausage and egg. Add another layer of fresh vegetables: bean sprouts, cucumber and coriander, to protect further. Scatter fried garlic and peanuts over. ;10. Wrap by rolling one end of the wrapper over the filling, folding in the two ends and rolling up like a bolster! Cut and serve. '

column11: 'Cooking Oil;water;tamarind pulp;Mackerel;Kaffir Lime Leaves;Sugar;Salt;Lady Finger;dried chillye;shallot;garlic;candlenut;turmeric;galangal;lemongrass;belachan'
column12: '175ml Cooking Oil;750ml water;75g tamarind pulp;900g Mackerel - sliced into 11/2 inch pieces;2 Kaffir Lime Leaves (optional);0.5 teaspoon Sugar;2.5 teaspoon Salt;20 young Lady Fingers / Okra;20 Dried chilly - soaked in water and drained;18 Shallots - peeled;2 cloves Garlic - peeled;5 Candlenuts (Buah Keras);0.5 inch Fresh Turmeric (Kunyit) - peeled;1 inch Galangal (Lengkuas) - peeled;4 stalks Lemongrass - sliced;1.5 teaspoon belachan'
column13: '1.Heat the cooking oil and fry finely ground paste until fragrant.;2.Add the tamarind juice (water+tamarind pulp) and bring to a boil. Simmer for 4 minutes. ;3.Increase the heat and add fish, kaffir lime leaves, sugar and salt. Cook for 4 minutes.;4.Add ladies fingers and cooked for another 5 minutes until the fish is done and ladies fingers are tender. '

column11: 'Sago Pearl;Gula Melaka;Coconut Milk;Pandan Leaf;Water;Salt'
column12: '200g Sago Pearl;200g Gula Melaka (Palm Sugar);250ml Coconut Milk;1 Pandan Leaf (Screwpine Leaf)- shred with a fork & tie into a knot;700ml  Water;0.5 teaspoons of Salt'
column13: '1.Bring water in a medium pot to boil and add in sago. Cook about 10 minutes until sago pearls become translucent (no more white dot in the middle) and stir constantly.;2.The water will turn starchy, strain the sago in a sieve and wash away excess starch in running cold water.;3.Scoop sago pearls into individual small glasses and Put in the fridge to chill.;4.In a small pot, pour in coconut milk with the pandan leaf and a pinch of salt. Boil at low heat and stir constantly. When it starts to boil, remove from heat and strain into a bowl then set aside to cool.;5.In another saucepan, melt the gula melaka with 2 tablespoons of water on a low heat. Once become it become syrup, set aside to chill.;6.Serve sago with drizzle of palm sugar syrup and coconut milk. '

column11: 'yam bean;guava;cucumber;carrot;green papaya;pomelo sac;rice flour;tapioca flour;egg;water;salt;sugar;small prawn;galangal;bird’s eye chilly;fresh red chilly;plum sauce;salt;cooking oil;crushed fried peanuts;toasted sesame seeds'
column12: '1 small yam bean;1 guava;1 cucumber;1 carrot;0.5 green papaya;1 cup peeled pomelo sacs;80g rice flour; 80g tapioca flour; 1 egg; 300ml water; 1 teaspoon salt; 1 teaspoon sugar; 200g small prawns;20g galangal; 5 stalks bird’s eye chilly; 1 stalk fresh red chilly; 300ml plum sauce; 1 teaspoon salt; 2 teaspoons cooking oil; 5 tablespoons crushed fried peanuts; 1 tablespoon toasted sesame seeds'
column13: '1. Fritters: Combine dry sifted ingredients in a bowl. Make a well in the centre, slowly whisk in egg, water, salt and sugar. Mix until a smooth batter is achieved. Add prawns. ;2. Heat oil in a wok, over medium heat pour a ladleful of batter into wok. A large round fritter will emerge. Slowly fry until brown, remove and drain onto paper towel. ;3. Repeat until all the batter is used up. ;4. When fitters are cool, keep in an airtight container. ;1. Sauce: Using an electric blender, finely blend galangal, bird’s eye chilly and chilly until fine, adding a little water if necessary to move the blades. ;2. Combine the ground spice paste with plum sauce, salt and oil, adjusting salt to taste. Add the crushed peanuts and sesame seeds. Set aside. ;1. Salad: Peel the pomelo and discard the skin to yield only the sacs, set aside. ;2. In a serving platter, mix yam, guava, cucumber, carrot, papaya (pick a slightly green and firm one), pomelo and crispy prawns. ;3. Drizzle sauce over, top with celery leaves, extra crushed peanuts and sesame seeds. '

column11: 'horse mackerel;tamarind paste;dried shrimp paste;lemongrass;chilly;onion;lime leave;salt;sugar;line'
column12: '4 medium-sized ikan selar or horse mackerel; 1 tablespoon tamarind paste; 1 teaspoon dried shrimp paste; 1 stalk lemongrass; 3 red chilly; 1/2 onion; 4 whole kaffir lime leaves; 1/2 teaspoon salt; 1/2 teaspoon sugar;1 lime'
column13: '1. Prepare the tamarind water by mixing the paste in 4-5 cups of water. Strain to rid it of seeds and grit. You want a thin infusion. ;2. Bring tamarind water to the boil in a pot together with the belacan and lemongrass stalk. ;3. When boiling, add in the onion rings, red chilly and kaffir lime leaves. Season with salt and sugar. ;4. Add the fish and turn off the heat as soon as it begins to boil again. ;5. Serve at once with warm plain rice and some lime quarters on the side. '

column11: 'spring roll wrappers;flour;cooking oil;curry Leaves;mustard seed;cumin; garlic;onion; fish curry powder; pumpkin; water; green peas; coconut milk; sugar; salt'
column12: '20 pieces spring roll wrappers; 3 tablespoons plain flour; cooking oil;2 tablespoons cooking oil ; 2 springs curry Leaves ; 1 teaspoon mustard seeds ; 1/4 teaspoon cumin ; 1 clove garlic; 1 big onion; 3 tablespoons fish curry powder; 350 g pumpkin; 80 ml water; 50 g green peas; 2 tablespoons coconut milk ; 1 teaspoon sugar ; 1 teaspoon salt'
column13: '1. Filling: Heat oil in a pan; add in spices till oil sizzles. ;2. Add garlic, onions and curry leaves and sauté until onions become limp. ;3. Add in curry paste and sauté till fragrant, adding in pumpkin and water. ;4. Cook until pumpkin is soft about (5-8 minutes). ;5. Mix in green peas, coconut milk and season to taste. ;6. Once mixture comes to a boil and turns dry, turn off the heat. Make sure the filling is dry before turning off the heat or you’ll end up with soggy samosa. ;7. Set aside to cool before wrapping. ;1. Wrapping: Place a spring roll wrapper on a clean surface. ;2. Top with 1-2 tablespoons of filling. Working from the bottom of the sheet, fold 2cm up in a straight horizontal line sealing edges with binding paste. ;3. From the top left hand corner, wrap over, creating a sharp corner on the left ending the sides at the horizontal line, then wrap over the right hand corner to form a triangle, sealing the edges with binding paste. ;4. Repeat with the remaining filling. ;5. Pre-heat cooking oil in a wok or deep-fryer and deep fry samosas until golden brown. Remove and drain on paper towels before serving warm.'

column11: 'cooking oil;cinnamon stick;star anise;clove;shallot;garlic;fish curry powder;water;tamarind paste;palm sugar;pineapple;coconut milk;salt'
column12: '3 tablespoons cooking oil;3cm cinnamon stick;2 star anise;2 cloves;3 shallots;2 cloves garlic;4 tablespoons fish curry powder;125ml water;15g tamarind paste;2 tablespoons palm sugar;600g pineapple;100ml coconut milk;1 teaspoon salt'
column13: '1.Heat oil, fry cinnamon stick, star anise and cloves for a few seconds before adding the sliced shallots and garlic.;2.Sauté until shallots are caramelised, add in curry paste.;3.Sauté for another 8-10 minutes until curry paste is fragrant.;4.Add in pineapple slices, water, sieved tamarind juice and sugar.;5.Simmer until pineapple is tender. Add more water if gravy becomes too thick. Lastly, add coconut milk and salt to taste.;6.Turn off heat once gravy comes to a boil. Set aside for 2 hours before serving.'

column11: 'chicken;belly pork;cooking oil;bean paste;palm sugar;shitake mushroom;water;potato;dark soya sauce;salt;shallot;garlic'
column12: '300g chicken;300g belly pork;6 tablespoons cooking oil;1.5 tablespoons bean paste or tau cheo;40g palm sugar;10 dried shitake mushrooms;80ml water;2 potatoes;1 teaspoon dark soya sauce;2 teaspoons salt;20 shallots;3 cloves garlic'
column13: '1.Using an electric blender, finely blend the spice paste.;2.Heat oil, add spice paste and sauté till fragrant.;3.Add in bean paste and stir-fry until oil starts to separate.;4.Add in belly pork and sauté for 5 minutes.;5.Mix in mushrooms and water and bring to a boil.;6.Lower heat and simmer for 20 minutes before adding chicken. Continue simmering until chicken and pork are tender; adding in potatoes half way through. Add more water if necessary.;7.Season to taste with sugar and salt.;8.Turn off heat and serve with steamed white rice'

column11: 'cooking oil;shallots;garlic;shallot;soya bean paste;prawn;chicken;yellow egg noodles;mustard green;bean sprout;water;dark soya sauce;light soya sauce;sugar;white pepper;Salt;fresh red chilly;red chilly padi;belachan;shallot crisp'
column12: '6 tablespoons cooking oil;3 shallots;2 cloves garlic;2 shallots;1 tablespoon soya bean paste;150g prawns;100g chicken meat;400g fresh yellow egg noodles;3 stalks mustard green “choy sum”;1 cup bean sprouts;0.5 cup water;0.5 teaspoon dark soya sauce;1 tablespoon light soya sauce;2 teaspoons sugar;0.25 teaspoon ground white pepper;0.5 teaspoon of Salt;8 stalks fresh red chilly;3 stalks red chilly padi;40g toasted belachan;5g of Shallot crisps'
column13: '1.Shallot crisps: Heat oil, fry sliced shallots over low to medium heat until lightly browned. Remove with slotted spoon and place onto paper towels. Set aside. Once cool, you may store in airtight containers and use whenever necessary.;2.Noodles: Using the same oil, fry chopped shallots and garlic until lightly browned.;3.Add in bean paste and stir to sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.;4.Add in sliced meat, prawns and choy sum. Continue to stir-fry for another 30 seconds over high heat then add stock.;5.Once it boils, add noodles, adjust seasonings to taste, toss in bean sprouts and turn off heat immediately.;6.Garnish hot noodles with shallot crisps and serve with some dried shrimp paste with a squeeze of kalamansi lime juice.;7.sambal belachan: Pound the ingredients using a mortar. Store the chilly in a container in the fridge for up to a week.'

column11: 'cooking oil;onion;chicken;brown sugar;kaffir lime leave;water;coconut milk;lime juice;Salt;shallot;garlic;ginger;galangal;turmeric;candle nut;lemon grass;dried chilly;bird’s eye chilly;belachan'
column12: '100 ml cooking oil; 1 big onion; 700 g chicken; 1/2 tablespoon brown sugar; 3 pieces kaffir lime leaves; 125 ml water; 125 ml thick coconut milk; 1 tablespoon lime juice; Salt;150g shallots;1 clove garlic;10g young ginger;10g galangal;10g turmeric;2 candle nuts;2 stalks lemon grass;5 stalks dried chilly;5 stalks bird’s eye chilly;10g toasted belachan'
column13: '1.Heat oil, fry sliced big onions until crispy. Remove and set aside.;2.Using an electric blender, finely blend spice paste till fine. Adding a little water to move the blades if necessary.;3.Using the same oil, sauté spice paste until fragrant over a medium flame, stirring continuously to prevent paste from burning or sticking to the wok.;4.Add chicken pieces, sugar, kaffir lime leaves and cook for 5-7 minutes.;5.Add water and simmer until chicken is almost tender (about 15-20 minutes).;6.Add the coconut milk, juice and adjust salt to taste.;7.Turn off heat and pour over the onion crisps and stir to combine.'

column11: 'glutinous rice;dried prawns;lean pork;candied winter melon;lemon grass;knob galangal;dried chilly;garlic;shallot;coriander seed;sugar;Blue pea flowers;pandan leave'
column12: '2kg glutinous rice;300g dried prawns;500g lean pork;100g candied winter melon;4 stalks lemon grass;5cm knob galangal;50g dried chilly;5 cloves garlic;10 shallots;3 tablespoons coriander seeds,;100 g sugar;5 Blue pea flowers;3 bundles large pandan leaves'
column13: '1.Drain glutinous rice and place in a colander to dry. Season with salt and lots of white pepper. Remove about a third of the rice and mix in blue dye from the blue pea flower or colouring.;2.Blend the lemon grass, dried chilly, dried prawns, galangal, shallots and garlic together. Add roasted coriander seeds, sugar and about 1 tablespoon each of light soya sauce, dark soya sauce, salt and more pepper.;3.Heat up oil in a large frying pan and fry spice mixture. Add minced lean pork and chopped candied winter melon and continue to fry till very fragrant. Adjust seasoning with salt or sugar to taste.;4.Make a cone with two pandan leaves and add a spoon of plain rice. Add a large spoonful of filling and cover mixture with a spoonful of blue-dyed rice and another spoonful of plain rice.;5.Fold over pandan leaf to make a pyramid and secure with a piece of reed or raffia.;6.Tie dumplings into bundles of 10 or 12 and thread onto a wooden spoon or long rolling pin. Hang over a pot of boiling water and cook for at least three to four hours. Keep adding boiling water to keep the heat constant.;7.Store cooked dumplings in the fridge and eat within the week.'

column11: 'hard tofu;sweet corn kernel;red bell pepper;snow pea pod;chilly paste;shallot;garlic;honey;salt'
column12: '2 pieces hard tofu (tau kwa);100g sweet corn kernels;1 red bell pepper;8 snow pea pods;1 tablespoon chilly paste;4 shallots;2 cloves garlic;1 tablespoon honey;1 teaspoon salt'
column13: '1.Process chilly paste, skinned shallots and garlic cloves into a fine puree. Heat up a little oil in a non-stick pan and fry the paste till fragrant. Season to taste with honey and salt. Cool to room temperature.;2.In a clean frying pan, heat up some vegetable oil and fry tofu cubes until they are lightly golden on all sides. Be patient, and use a medium fire to make sure the tofu is tender inside but nice and crisp outside.;3.While tofu is frying, wash and rinse red bell pepper and snow peas.;4.Dice red pepper, and slice each snow pea pod into thin slivers on the diagonal. Chill in the fridge until ready to use.;5.When all the tofu cubes are ready, pour away any excess oil from the frying pan and add the chilly dressing. Toss the tofu cubes so they are thoroughly coated. Plate the tofu cubes and pile on the diced red pepper, sweet corn kernels and the snow pea slivers. Serve at once and allow each diner to toss their own portion of salad at the table.'

column11: 'round cabbage;pork belly;dried black fungus;dried lily buds;sweet dried bean curd;dried tang hoon;dried mushrooms;dried prawn;fresh garlic;tau cheoh paste;dark soya sauce;cooking oil;chicken seasoning powder'
column12: '500g round cabbage ;100g pork belly;10g dried black fungus;5g dried lily buds;10g sweet dried bean curd;20g dried tang hoon;10g dried mushrooms;10g dried prawns;3 cloves fresh garlic;10g tau cheoh paste;1 tablespoon dark soya sauce;5 tablespoons cooking oil;1 teaspoon chicken seasoning powder'
column13: '1.Wash and cut cabbage according to your preference.;2.Soak the dried fungus, lily buds and dried tang hoon in water, separately, for 10 minutes.;3.Cut the dried bean curd sheets into several portions and soak in water for 5 minutes;4.Wash and boil the dried mushrooms in a small cooking pot with 1 tablespoon dark soya sauce, over low fire for 20 minutes.;5.Wash and cut the pork belly into thin slices and add into the boiling mushroom mixture sauce. Cook for another 10 minutes.;6.Heat up the tau cheoh paste, add in all the ingredients including the cut cabbage and stir fry before adding in the pre-cooked mushroom and pork belly, along with its stock mixture.;7.Cook over moderate fire for 25 minutes.;8.Add in the soaked tang hoon'

column11: 'chicken drummets;ginger juice; corn flour;chilly flakes;oyster sauce; chicken stock granules; dark soya sauce;lime leaves;honey;salt'
column12: '16 pieces chicken drummets;2 tablespoons ginger juice;1 tablespoon corn flour;1 tablespoon chilly flakes;1 tablespoon oyster sauce;1 teaspoon chicken stock granules;0.25 teaspoon dark soya sauce;10 kaffir lime leaves;2 tablespoons honey;1 tablespoon salt'
column13: '1.In a mixing bowl, combine all marinade ingredients together and toss in chicken drummets. Adjust seasoning to taste. ;2.Refrigerate the drummets for 3 hours or preferably overnight in the coolest part of your fridge.;3.Heat oven to 200?C in grill function. Place the drummets and the marinade on a greased plate and grill the marinated chicken drummets, turning over once after 15-18 minutes or until juice runs clear when the meat is poked. ;4.Garnish drummets with a sprinkling of sesame seeds and serve immediately with a glass of wine or some beer.'

column11: 'turkey;onion;carrot; celery;Thai sweet basil;kaffir lime leave;laksa leaves;salt;dried shrimp paste;vegetable oil; olive oil;Pepper;kaffir lime leaves;corn flour;white wine'
column12: '4kg turkey;1 medium-sized onion;1 stalk carrot;1 stick celery;1 small bunch Thai sweet basil;1 small bunch kaffir lime leaves;1 small bunch laksa leaves;1 teaspoon salt;1 tablespoon dried shrimp paste;0.75 cup vegetable or olive oil;2 teaspoons of Pepper;1 spring kaffir lime leaves;1 tablespoon corn flour;1 cup white wine'
column13: '1.Remove the neck and giblets from the cavity and place in a pot with water to cover. Add an onion, carrot and celery stick. Cook slowly for one hour. Strain and keep aside one cup. Freeze rest of stock for another use. ;2.Using only the herbs leaves and tender stems, plucked into short lengths, process in a chopper with oil, dried shrimp paste and salt till roughly chopped. ;3.Wash turkey well inside and out and dry with paper towels. ;4.Rub herb paste over turkey, including the cavity. If you can, rub some paste under the skin.;5.Leave turkey in the fridge to marinate covered for at least two hours. ;6.Heat oven 200ºC. Place kaffir lime leaves into the cavity of the bird and roast on a pan in the middle of the oven. ;7.Cook for one hour, loosely covered with foil, then remove foil, reduce heat to 180ºC and roast for another hour until the bird is golden brown and cooked. Test by poking a fork into the thickest part of the thigh, if juices run clear, it is ready. ;8.Remove turkey from pan and rest for half an hour. Pour a cup of stock (or white wine) into the pan. Heat over the stove, scraping to dissolve the burnt bits. If liked, add corn flour and stir till sauce is thickened. Season to taste.'

column11: 'sweet potato flesh;coarse sugar;water;tapioca flour;thick coconut milk;salt;coconut flesh'
column12: '300g sweet potato flesh; 150g coarse sugar; 100ml water; 150g tapioca flour; 250ml thick coconut milk; 0.5 teaspoon of salt; 100g grated coconut flesh'
column13: '1.Scrub and clean 380g sweet potatoes under running water before steaming them over high heat until the flesh is tender. Peel off skin to yield 300g of sweet potato flesh.;2.In a small saucepan, cook sugar, water and pandan leaves until sugar dissolves. Discard the pandan leaves.;3.Using an electric blender, finely blend sweet potatoes with the sugar syrup.;4.Mix pureed potato, with sifted tapioca flour, coconut milk and salt.;5.Pour batter into the greased pan and steam over boiling water for 30-35 minutes.;6.Remove from steamer and leave to cool for 4 hours before slicing into pieces.;7.In a plate mix the grated white coconut flesh with salt. Toss the sweet potato slices in the coconut and serve immediately.'

column1: 'Turmeric rice dumplings with dried shrimp sambal'
column11: 'glutinous rice;turmeric;tamarind peel;pepper corn;salt;dried bamboo leave;hemp string;cooking oil;dried chilly;shallot;sugar;salt;dried prawn'
column12: '500g glutinous rice;1 tablespoon freshly ground turmeric;1 pc tamarind peel;1 teaspoon pepper corns;0.5  teaspoon of salt;32 pcs dried bamboo leaves;5 meters hemp string;118ml cooking oil;35 stalks dried chilly;320 g shallots;4 tablespoons sugar ;1 teaspoon salt;250g dried prawns'
column13: '1.Rinse the rice and then soak the rice in clear water with the turmeric and tamarind peel for 3 hours. An hour in, soak the dried bamboo leaves in a separate container and then wash them clean. ;2.To prepare the filling, put together the spice paste ingredients in a mixer and grind. ;3.Heat the oil in the wok, and stir-fry paste ingredients for 10 minutes. ;4.Add the ground dried prawns and season with salt and sugar. Cook this over low heat until the mixture is relatively dry. Turn off heat and set aside. ;5.Start preparing the rice: discard the tamarind peel, rinse the soaked rice in running tap water and drain. Stir in the peppercorns. ;6.To wrap the dumplings: take two washed bamboo leaves and fold one end to form a cone. ;7.Line the cone with the glutinous rice, then place two heaped tablespoons of filling in the rice before covering the filling with more rice. ;8.Using the palm of your free hand, press down to compress the dumpling. ;9.Wrap the dumpling up following the natural lines of the leaves. Make sure there are no holes. ;10.Tie tightly with the hemp string and repeat until all dumplings are tied. The first one usually looks the ugliest — it does get better. ;11.Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add salt and leave the dumplings in rapidly boiling water for 2–21/4 hours. ;12.Once cooked, hang dumplings to drip off excess water before storing or eating.'

column11: 'pork;tamarind paste;water;salt;sugar'
column12: '0.5kg pork belly;3 heaped tablespoons tamarind paste;1 cup water;1 tablespoon salt;2 teaspoons sugar'
column13: '1.Using tweezers, pluck pork skin clean of bristles. ;2.Make marinade by mixing tamarind paste with water. Add salt and sugar. The consistency should be thick. ;3.Marinate the whole piece of pork in this mixture overnight, covered, in the fridge. ;4.The next day, boil pork and marinade over a moderate fire until the meat is tender. ;5.Just before serving, cut the pork into thick slices. Lay out slices, without overlapping, on an oven tray and grill in a hot oven until browned. ;6.In the meantime, cook down marinade in the pan. Add a little over each slice of grilled pork and serve with a dip of chopped garlic and vinegar to cut through the richness.'

column11: 'chicken;rice;corn oil;ginger;scallion;mushroom;oyster sauce;soy sauce;corn starch;sesame oil;white pepper;sugar;shaoxing wine;dark soy sauce;salt'

column13: '1.Chop the chicken breast and chicken drumsticks into pieces.;2.Marinate the chicken with all the Marinade for 30 minutes.;3.When the chicken is ready, rinse and clean the rice in a rice cooker and leave just enough water to cook the rice.;4.Add the Rice Seasoning into the rice and water. Add in the ginger, stir-fry until aromatic before adding the chicken and shiitake mushrooms.;6.Quickly stir-fry the chicken until   half-cooked. Add in the chopped scallions. Dish out and set aside.;7.Add the chicken into the rice cooker when the rice is almost dry and continue to cook till rice is completely cooked.;8.Leave the rice cooker on “Stay Warm” for 15 – 20 minutes before serving.1.Chop the chicken breast and chicken drumsticks into pieces.'

column13: '1.Heat oil and saute *spice paste till fragrant. Add prawn shells and stir fry till fragrant for about 5 minutes. Sprinkle over rock sugar and continue frying for a few more minutes.;2.Pour in water and bring to a boil. Simmer over low heat for 15 minutes. Remove from heat.;3.Let stock cool a little before liquidising prawn heads and shells in an electric blender. Sieve into a clean stockpot.;4.Add pork ribs or chicken pieces and simmer over low heat for 25 minutes or until meat is tender.;5.Using the same stock, cook lean meat until for about 8 - 10 minutes, remove and slice.;6.Boil prawns for 1-2 minutes, remove and set aside.;7.Adjust stock seasonings to taste with   salt.;8.Place a portion of rice vermicelli, noodles, bean sprouts and kang kong in a bowl.;9.Ladle over hot broth with a few pieces of meat.;10.Top with a quarter egg, meat slices, prawns and sprinkle with shallot crisps.;11.Serve immediately with chilli paste* in a small dish.;12.For the spice paste: Heat oil and saute the ground chilli paste ingredients over low heat till fragrant.;13.Season to taste with salt and sugar.'

column11: 'black pepper;unsalted butter;garlic;onion;crab;oyster sauce;sugar;water;salt'
column12: '1 tablespoon black pepper;4 tablespoons melted unsalted butter;3 cloves garlic;1/8 small onion;1 kilo crab;1 tablespoon oyster sauce;1/2 tablespoon sugar ;2 tablespoons water;Salt'
column13: 'Prepare the black pepper by pounding them with a mortar and pestle. Make sure they are slightly coarse, not powdery.;Heat up a wok with the butter. Saute the garlic and onion for 1 minute before adding the black pepper.;As soon as you smell the peppery aroma, add the crab into the wok and stir to combine well with the black pepper.;Add the oyster sauce, sugar, water and stir continuously to blend well with the crab.;Turn the heat to medium. Cover the wok with its lid until the crab turns red or completely cooked through.;Add salt to taste and a little bit of water (if the crab becomes too dry), if needed. Dish out and serve immediately.'

column11: 'pork mince;onion;patato;frozen peas;dark soya sauce;salt;stick of cinnamon;clovea;pepper;vegetable oil'
column12: '500g pork mince;1 large onion;2 potatoes;250g frozen peas;1 teaspoon dark soya sauce;1 teaspoon salt;1 small stick of cinnamon;3 cloves;1 dash of pepper;2 teaspoons vegetable oil'
column13: 'Heat oil in a hot pan. Saute onions till soft and fragrant. Add mince and break up meat with a fork to brown.;Add potato, cinnamon and cloves. Season with soy sauce, salt and pepper. Stir well. Add half cup of water and bring to simmering point to help potatoes to soften.;When potatoes are tender, add peas. Mix well. Taste and adjust seasoning. If it seems too dry, add a splash of water to add moisture.'

column11: 'water;chicken;dried squid;chicken stock granules;date;pepper;carrot;lotus root;salt'
column12: '0.5 litres water;400g chicken meat or spare ribs;1 piece dried squid;1 tablespoon chicken stock granules;8 red dates;0.25 teaspoon pepper;1 carrot;350g lotus roots;0.5 teaspoon of Salt'
column13: 'Using a peeler, remove the skin of the lotus roots and slice them into 0.5cm thick pieces. Set aside.;Blanch chicken meat or spare-ribs in boiling water. Remove and drain.;Bring the water to a boil in a stockpot. Add chicken meat/ spare-ribs into the boiling water. Add in the lotus root slices, dried squid, chicken stock granules, dates and pepper and simmer the soup over low heat until the meat is tender. Using low heat ensures a clear soup.;Half way through, add the carrots and continue cooking until meat is tender. Add seasoning and serve hot.'

column1: 'Clams in Chinese rice wine ginger and chili'
column11: 'clam; onion;garlic;vegetable oil;chinese rice wine;ginger;chilies;sasame oil;spring onion;light soya sauce'
column12: '1 kg clams;1 onion;4 cloves garlic;2 tablespoons vegetable oil;0.5 cup Chinese rice wine;5 slices ginger;2 chilies;0.5 tablespoon sesame oil;1 spring spring onion;1 tablespoon light soya sauce'
column13: 'Soak the clams in salted water for about half an hour to get rid of excess grit.;Over medium heat, fry the onion and garlic until fragrant.;Add the Chinese rice wine, ginger, chili, clams and sesame oil. Cover with a tight lid until the clams start opening (about 1 minute).;Add the spring onion and serve immediately.'

column11: 'prawn;butter;salt;pepper'
column12: '8 large prawns;3 tablespoons butter;0.5 teaspoon of Salt;0.5 teaspoon of pepper;TOPPING:;8 tablespoons nestum;1 handful curry leaves;2 chilly padi;1 teaspoon salt;1 tablespoon sugar;80 g salted butter'
column13: 'Preheat the oven to 230?C.;Brush the prawns with the melted butter and season with salt and pepper.;Roast in the oven for 10-12 minutes, until the prawns are fully pink.;For the topping, melt the butter over medium heat until it starts foaming.;Add the curry leaves and chilly (be careful the oil in the butter will spit) and fry briefly for about 10 seconds before adding the cereal (you may use the Nestum cereal).;Fry until the cereal starts turning slightly brown. Add the salt and sugar before reserving in a bowl.;Serve the roasted prawns with a tablespoon of the cereal topping.'

column11: 'fish fillet;fish bones;ginger;tianjin preserved vegetable;dried seaweed;light soya sauce;sesame oil;rice wine;pepper;hua tiao wine;water;spring onion;coriander;cooked rice'
column12: '500g fish fillet;500g fish bones;3 ginger;1 tablespoon Tianjin preserved vegetables;1 teaspoon of Dried seaweed;1 tablespoon light soy sauce;0.5 tablespoon sesame oil;1 teaspoon rice wine;1 teaspoon of Pepper;2 tablespoons hua tiao wine;2 litres water;2 slices ginger;2 stalks spring onions;2 stalks coriander;2 cups cooked rice'
column13: 'Brown fish bones in a little oil and ginger. Add water and simmer for about 30 minutes. Do not boil. Turn off fire and add salt and pepper to taste.;Place the rice into serving bowls and ladle the steaming hot soup over. Add the laver sheets and the marinated fish slices. Garnish with spring onions and coriander.'

column11: 'cod fillet;salt;white pepper;tomato;sour plum;silken tofu;ginger;cooking oil;garlic;pork;preserved mustard;water;soy sauce;shaoxing wine;sugar;onion;coriander'
column12: '400 g cod fillet;0.5 teaspoon of salt;0.5 teaspoon of white pepper;1 big tomato;1 piece sour plum;200g silken tofu;4 slices of ginger;2 tablespoons cooking oil;2 cloves garlic;40g pork;100g preserved mustard;FOR THE SAUCE:;4 tablespoons water;1 tablespoon soy sauce;0.5 tablespoons Shaoxing wine;0.5 teaspoon of sugar;FOR THE GARNISH:;1 green onion;2 .5cm knob of ginger;A small handful of coriander'
column13: 'Sprinkle salt and white pepper on both sides of the fish fillet and set in a deep dish.;Arrange the tomato wedges, sour plum and tofu around the fish, and place the ginger slices on top.;In a small bowl, mix all the ingredients for the sauce and set aside.;In a sauce pan, heat up the cooking oil and add in the chopped garlic. column11: 'glutinous rice;chinese dried mushroom;chinese sausage;dried prawn;shallot;peanut;salt;light soya sauce; dark soya sauce;spring onion'
column12: '1kg white glutinous rice;80g Chinese dried mushrooms;200g Chinese sausages;20 g dried prawns;100g shallots;10 g peanuts;0.5 teaspoon of Salt;2 teaspoon of light soya sauce;2 teaspoon of dark soya sauce;2 spring onions'
column13: 'Heat up some oil and fry sliced shallots until they are lightly browned. Remove the shallots, drain and keep the oil in the wok.;Add sliced mushrooms, sausage slices and dried prawns and stir fry over high heat till fragrant.;Add the drained glutinous rice and season with salt, light and dark soya sauces to taste. Stir thoroughly so rice takes on an even colour.;Remove the rice from the pan and place into individual containers.;Heat up water in a steamer to a rapid boil. Steam rice over high heat for 30 to 45 minutes or until soft and tender.;Garnish with fried shallots and chopped green onions.'

column1: 'Steamed prawn with rice wine and wolfberry '
column11: 'prawn;garlic;wolfberry;chinese rice wine;sugar;chicken bouillon;salt;water'

column13: 'Make a slit at the back of the prawns, remove vein and clean well.;Marinate the prawns with all ingredients for 15 minutes.;Heat up a wok with water and steam for approximately 8 minutes. Dish out and serve hot.'

column11: 'glutinous rice;pork hock with skin;lean pork;dried shiitake mushroom;chinese chestnut;garlic;soy sauce;five-spice powder;salt;pepper;salted egg yolk;bamboo leave'
column12: '2kg glutinous rice;500g pork hock with skin;100g lean pork;30 small dried shiitake mushrooms;30 dried Chinese chestnuts;10 cloves garlic,;2 teaspoon of Soy sauce;5 spice powder;0.5 teaspoon of salt;0.5 teaspoon of pepper;20 salted egg yolks;3 bundles bamboo leaves'
column13: 'Drain glutinous rice and place in a colander to dry.;Marinate both pork hock and lean pork with 2 tablespoon light soya sauce, 2 tablespoon dark soya sauce and plenty of salt and pepper.;Heat up oil in a large frying pan and fry garlic till lightly golden. Add drained rice and season with more dark soya sauce and a little five-spice powder. Just toss enough to mix in garlic and seasoning. Remove to big mixing bowl.;Make a cone with two bamboo leaves and add a spoon of rice. Add the two types of pork, chestnut and mushroom, and half an egg yolk.;Cover mixture with more glutinous rice.;Fold over bamboo leaf to make a pyramid and secure with a piece of reed or raffia.;Tie dumplings into bundles of 10 or 12 and thread onto a wooden spoon or long rolling pin. Hang over a pot of boiling water and cook for at least three to four hours. Keep adding boiling water to keep the heat constant.;When dumplings are cooked, they come away from the leaves easily and the rice will stick together. If they break apart into loose grains, you have to cook it longer.;Store cooked dumplings in a cool place, preferably in the fridge. Do not keep more than a week.'

column11: 'golden snapper fish;cooking oil;shallot;garlic;tamarind pulp;chili padi;sugar;salt'
column12: '2 pieces golden snapper fish or ikan jenahak;125ml cooking oil;6 shallots;6 cloves garlic;50g tamarind pulp;10g red chilli padi;2 tablespoons sugar;1 teaspoon salt'
column13: 'Heat oil in a wok and fry the shallot until crispy, remove and set aside.;Using the same oil, fry the garlic slices until light brown, remove and set aside.;Remove some of the oil leaving about 3-4 tablespoons.;Fry the fish over high heat, turning over once and remove from oil.;In a clean wok, bring tamarind juice, chilli, sugar and salt to a boil.;Adjust seasonings to taste and add in fish, simmering for 5 minutes or until fish is cooked.;Add half of the shallot crisps and garlic crisps into the gravy and turn off heat.;Just before serving, top with the shallot and garlic crisps. Serve with white rice.'

column11: 'snapper;salted vegetable;plum;corn flour;tomato;red chili;coriander;sesame oil'
column12: '1 large snapper or pomfret;1 packet salted vegetables (kiamchye);3 pickled plums;1 teaspoon corn flour;2 large tomatoes;1 red chili;2 Coriander;5 teaspoon of Sesame oil'
column13: 'Clean the fish and make slashes across the thickest part of the fish.;Rinse and pat dry, dust lightly with corn flour.;Heat up a wok without any oil and dry fry the salted vegetables for a few minutes. Add a little oil and the plums and half the tomatoes.;Add enough water or light chicken stock to cover the vegetables. When the stock is boiling, place the fish on top of the mixture and ladle hot stock over the fish. Cover the pan.;Allow the fish to simmer for about 5 minutes each side. When you are flipping the fish, be careful not to break the skin.;Add the rest of the tomatoes and the chilli. Bring the stock back to a boil and turn off heat immediately.;Serve fish with the salted vegetables and tomatoes. Garnish with coriander and chilli and add some sesame oil. Serve hot.'

column11: 'dried egg noodle;egg;dried shrimp;shiitake mushroom;sugar;soy sauce;oyster sauce;onion;coriander;water;salt;pepper;cooking oil'
column12: '300g dried egg noodles ;2 eggs;100g dried shrimps;8 dried shiitake mushrooms;1 teaspoon sugar;1 tablespoon soy sauce;3 tablespoons oyster sauce;3 stalks spring onions;1 spring of coriander;500ml of Water;0.5 teaspoon of Salt;0.5 teaspoon of pepper;5 teaspoon of cooking Oil'
column13: 'Prepare dried egg noodles in boiling water, following pack instructions.;Beat two eggs and season with a pinch of salt and white pepper. Heat oil in a wok and once the oil is shimmering, tip in the eggs. Allow to set and flip. Once cooked, allow the omelette to cool and cut into strips or ribbons (about 5cm in width).;Pound the softened dried prawns slightly, while saving and straining the water used to soak the dried prawns.;Slice the reconstituted shiitake mushrooms, while also saving and straining the water used from soaking the dried mushrooms.;Mix the sugar, soy sauce and oyster sauce together. Set aside.;Heat wok over high heat, add 3 tablespoons of oil.;Add the mushrooms and stir-fry for 3 minutes, until mushrooms are slightly browned. Add the dried prawns and stir-fry for another 3 minutes.;Add the noodles and stir fry together with the seasonings, ensuring that the noodles are evenly coated with the seasonings.;If the noodles start to stick to the wok, add the reserved mushrooms and dried prawn water.;Remove from wok and garnish with omelette, spring onions and coriander.'

column11: 'egg;water;fresh milk;chicken stock granule;ground pepper;century egg;salted egg yolk;crabstick;spring onion;sesame oil;salt;garlic crips cooking oil'
column12: '4 chicken eggs;500ml water;125ml fresh milk;1 teaspoon chicken stock granules;0.5 teaspoon ground pepper;2 century eggs;1 salted egg yolk;2 crabsticks;1 tablespoons chopped spring onions;1 teaspoon sesame oil;0.5 teaspoon salt;GARNISHING:;Garlic crisps;cooking oil'
column13: 'Bring water to a boil in the steamer.;In a mixing bowl, combine all the ingredients in a large bowl, adjusting seasonings to taste.;Pour egg batter into a heat proof plate.;Lower heat and steam for 15-20 minutes. High heat produces a coarse texture in the egg custard.;Open the steamer cover every 5 minutes to check if it’s cooked and remove once the custard is set.;Garnish before serving.'

column11: 'butter;cooking oil;shallot;eye chilies;bird eye chilies;curry leave;salted egg yolk;evaporated milk;water;prawn;sugar;salt'
column12: '60g butter;2 tablespoons cooking oil;3 shallots;6 birds eye chillies;3 sprigs curry leaves;3 salted egg yolks;150ml evaporated milk;3 tablespoons water;500g fresh medium sized prawns;0.5 teaspoon sugar;0.5 teaspoon salt'
column13: 'Buy fresh prawns, slit the back of the prawn using a sharp knife, devein, wash and drain in a colander. Draining the prawns ensures the dish will not be soggy.;Heat butter and oil in a wok, sauté chopped shallots until fragrant.;Add in birds eye chilies, curry leaves and cook for 10 seconds.;Add in salted egg yolks and mash further with the back of the ladle.;Add in milk, water, sugar and salt to taste. column11: 'garlic;ginger;onion;pork belly;prawn;clam;cabbage;celery;carrot;chinese chive;chinese mushroom;wheat flour noodle;chicken stock;hua tiao wine;salt;chicken powder;oyster sauce;sugar;peanut;seaweed;onion;pepper powder'
column12: '2 cloves garlic;5g ginger;10g onions;30g pork belly;2 prawns;5 pieces clams;50g cabbage;6 pieces celery;10g carrots;5g Chinese chives;1 piece Chinese mushrooms;150g wheat flour noodles;100ml of Chicken stock ;600ml Hua Tiao wine ;0.25 teaspoon salt;0.25 teaspoon Chicken powder ;0.25 teaspoon oyster sauce;0.25 teaspoon sugar;15g peanuts ;10g seaweed;3 Spring onions;0.25 teaspoon of white pepper powder'
column13: 'Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a wok and fry garlic, ginger and onions until fragrant.;Add in the other ingredients (pork, prawns, clams, vegetables) and mix well. Add chicken stock.;Add in wheat flour noodles and fry it over high heat for about 30 seconds to induce ‘wok hei’. Ensure that the noodles are not clumping together. (you can use the mee hoon kway noodles that you find in supermarkets);Add seasoning and allow the noodles to braise for a while.;Thicken the soup lightly with a little corn flour mixture.;Splash Hua Tiao wine around the wok just before serving and toss well. Transfer to bowl.;Garnish with peanuts, seaweed, spring onions and a dash of pepper powder. Serve.'

column11: 'beef top sirlion steak;soy sauce;sugar;corn starch;ginger;vegetable oil;onion;green bell pepper;tomato'
column12: '1 pound beef top sirloin steak ;0.25 cup soy sauce ;2 tablespoons white sugar ;2 tablespoons cornstarch ;0.5 teaspoon ground ginger ;3 tablespoons vegetable oil;1 divided red onion;1 green bell pepper (cut into 1-inch squares);2 tomatoes (cut into 1-inch squares, cut into wedges)'
column13: 'clean the fish and make slashes across the thickest part of the fish.;Rinse and pat dry, dust lightly with corn flour.;Heat up a wok without any oil and dry fry the salted vegetables for a few minutes. Add a little oil and the plums and half the tomatoes.";Whisk together soy sauce, sugar, cornstarch, and ginger in a bowl until the sugar has dissolved and the mixture is smooth. Place the steak slices into the marinade, and stir until well-coated.;Heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat, and place easy of the steak strips into the hot oil. Cook and stir until the beef is well-browned, about 3 minutes, and remove the beef from the wok to a bowl. Toss the beef and onion together until the onion begins to soften, about 2 minutes, then stir in the green pepper. Cook and stir the mixture until the pepper has turned bright green and started to become tender, about 2 minutes, then add the tomatoes, stir everything together, and serve.'

column11: 'sugar;flour;egg;butter;dash vanilla;sugar;water;evaporated milk'
column12: '1 cup confectioners sugar ;3 cups all-purpose flour ;1 cup butter ;1 egg beaten 1 dash vanilla ;0.7 cup white sugar ;100ml water ;9 eggs;1 beaten dash vanilla;1 cup evaporated milk'
column13: 'In a medium bowl, mix together the confectioners sugar and flour. Mix in butter with a fork until it is in small crumbs. Stir in the egg and vanilla until the mixture forms a dough. The texture should be slightly moist. Add more butter if it is too dry, or more flour, if the dough seems greasy. Shape dough into 1 1/2 inch balls, and press the balls into tart molds so that it covers the bottom, and goes up higher than the sides. Use 2 fingers to shape the edge into an A shape.;Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Combine the white sugar and water in a medium saucepan, and bring to a boil. Cook until the sugar is dissolved, remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Strain the eggs through a sieve, and whisk into the sugar mixture. Stir in the evaporated milk and vanilla. Strain the filling through a sieve, and fill the tart shells.;Bake for 15 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown, and the filling is puffed up a little bit.'

column11: 'chicken; potatoes; oil; chicken curry powder; onions; lemon grass; water; coconut milk; evaporated milk; salt; sugar; curry leaves; garlic; shallot; lemon grass'

column13: '1 Cut potatoes into pieces and deep fry them until golden brown. Set aside;2 Combine all Ingredient A in a blender and blend well.;3 Heat up cooking oil, add in Ingredients A and stir-fry with low heat until fragrant.;4 Add in onions, lemon grass, curry powder and have a few quick stirs.;5 Add in chicken, potatoes and water. Cover up and cook until the chicken pieces are thoroughly cooked.;6 Add coconut milk, evaporated milk, sugar, salt and cook until the curry boils. Add curry leaves'

column13: '1 Heat about 2 tablespoon oil and sauté Spice A for 10 seconds over medium heat. column11: 'basmati rice; cardamom; cloves; cinnamon stick; saffron strands; water; salt; boneless chicken leg; Indian yoghurt;  smoked paprika; grated ginger; cracked black pepper; turmeric powder; cumin powder; sea salt'

column13: '1 Add all the ingredients for the spiced chicken (except the chicken leg) and mix well.;2 Smear the spiced yoghurt all over the chicken and allow to marinade for 1-2 hours.;3 Add all the ingredients for the rice in a pot and simmer over high heat covered.;4 Once it starts boiling, turn the heat down to a simmer until the rice is tender and cooked.;5 Preheat the oven to 230?C and roast the chicken pieces on a roasting rack for about 15-20 minutes until nicely browned.;6 Divide the chicken with the biryani rice and serve immediately. '

column11: 'sugar; warm water; active dry yeast; all-purpose flour; plain yogurt; oil; salted butter'
column12: '1 teaspoon sugar;0.75 cup warm water;0.25 oz active dry yeast;2 cups all-purpose flour;0.5 cup plain yogurt;1 tablespoon oil;5 teaspoon of Some oil, for greasing the skillet;3 tablespoons melted salted butter'
column13: '1 In a small bowl, add the sugar, warm water, and yeast together. ;2. Stir to combine well. The yeast should be activated when it becomes foamy, about 10 minutes. ;3 Transfer the flour to a flat surface and make a well in the middle. ;4 Add the yeast mixture, yoghurt, and oil, knead the dough until the surface becomes smooth and shiny, about 10 minutes. ;5 Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rise in a warm place (for example: beside the stovetop or warm oven). The dough should double in size, about 1 hour.'

column11: 'chicken legs; Oil; lime; Greek yogurt; minced ginger; minced garlic; Garam Masala; cayenne pepper; lime juice; oil; salt; turmeric powder; Red coloring '
column12: '1 lb chicken legs;5 teaspoon of Oil, for basting;1 lime, cut into wedges;0.5 cup Greek yogurt;1 teaspoon finely minced ginger;1 teaspoon finely minced garlic;0.5 teaspoon Garam Masala;0.25 teaspoon cayenne pepper;2 tablespoons lime juice;1 tablespoons oil;0.5 teaspoons salt or to taste;0.25 teaspoon turmeric powder;2g Red coloring, optional'
column13: '1 Clean and pat dry the chicken with paper towels.;2 Mix all the ingredients of the Marinade in a bowl. Stir to combine well. ;3 Add the chicken to the Marinade and marinate for at least 2 hours, or best 4 hours.;4 Preheat the oven to 400°F. Line the baking sheet with aluminum foil and place a wire rack over it. Place the chicken on the wire rack. Bake for 20 minutes, then turn the chicken over and bake for another 20 minutes. Using a small brush, baste both surfaces of the chicken with the oil a couple of times during baking. Broil the chicken for 1 minute or until the skin is slightly charred. Remove from the oven and serve immediately with lime wedges.'

column11: 'flour; Kosher salt; Granulated sugar; Ghee; Egg; milk; water'
column12: '580g All purpose flour ;1.5 teaspoon Kosher salt;1 teaspoon Granulated sugar;0.75 cup Ghee, room temperature ;1 large Egg, beaten;0.75 cup Whole milk;0.5 cup Water'
column13: '1 Form sheets into layered ropes and each time it is form, try to trap air into the layer;2 Beginning from one end, coil up the rolled rope into a loose pinwheel;3 Pull the outer end into center, and tuck it in. Flip the coil over. Each coiled disc should resemble a turban;4 Let them rest at least 5 minutes for gluten (protein) to relax. This will make flat  tening them easier, and result in a more tender flatbread. ;5 Heat a griddle or large saute pan over low flame. Firmly flatten and spread one disc of dough until it is 7inches to 8inches in diameter or (18 to 20 cm.) The dough will be elastic, and may pull back a little. That is okay. Drizzle the gr iddle with a little ghee.;6  Add one bread to the pan, and cook slowly, turning once, 3 to 4 minutes per side, rotating occasionally to ensure even browning. Cook until each side is deep golden brown'

column11: 'all-purpose flour; semolina; oil; salt; ajwain seeds; water; medium sized potatoes; sweet green peas; thinly sliced onions; cumin seeds; minced green chili; coriander powder'
column12: '0.5 cup of all-purpose flour (if you are familiar with Indian wheat flour or durum aata you can use that as well);2 teaspoon semolina (cream of wheat);2 teaspoon oil;1 teaspoon salt;0.5 ajwain seeds (optional);0.7 cups of water;2 medium sized potatoes (I use Yukon gold);0.5 cup sweet green peas;1 cup thinly sliced onions;1 teaspoon cumin seeds;1 teaspoon minced green chilly;0.5 teaspoon coriander powder (optional)'
column13: '1 Add oil into the flour and mix it all very well together. To mix the oil well into the flour, take flour in small portions in your hand and rub it between your palms. ;2 To make sure that the oil is mixed well, hold the flour in your fist, press tightly and open the fist, the flour should still hold itself.;3 Now add water in small portions and try to make dough out of it. ;4 Once the dough comes together, work it for another 5 minutes. ;5 Wrap with a plastic wrap and let it rest for 30 minutes.;6 For the filling, boil potatoes. Cool and then mash them. Set aside.;7 Heat oil in a pan. Add cumin seeds. Once they start to pop add chili and onion. Cook until onion becomes translucent. Then add peas and turmeric. Once the peas are cooked, add coriander powder, salt and mashed potatoes. Mix everything well together and set it aside for the mixture to cool before using them for filling.;8 Use warm oil to fry their samosas. They drop them in oil which is a little over room temperature and slowly increase the temperature of oil. ;9 Start by rolling a lemon size ball of dough into a circle using a rolling pin. The flat circle should be around 11-12 cm in diameter.;10 Cut the big circle into two semicircles. Take about two spoons of potato mixture, make a ball off of it and place it in the center of the semicircle. Now dip your finger in water and rub it at the straight edge of the semicircle to make it wet so that it can stick.;11 Pick it from one side and place it over the potato ball covering it half way. Then pick the other side and place it over to the previous one, covering the potato to make a triangle shape. The two flaps should stick to each other right at the center of the samosa. The third side of the triangle should be still open. Use a little water, make it wet and stick the two flaps together with your finger. Repeat the process with the rest of the dough.;12 Use a wok or deep fryer to fry the samosas till they turn golden brown in color'

column13: '1 Heat the butter in a pan over low heat. ;2 Add the ginger, garlic, and saute for about 1-2 minutes or until aromatic. ;3 Add the tomato paste and chili powder, stir to mix well, about 30 seconds.;4 Add the Tandoori Chicken and Garam Masala into the pan, stir and let simmer for 10 minutes. column12: '2 tablespoons vegetable oil;0.75 teaspoon cumin seeds;1 large onion, minced;2 teaspoons ginger-garlic paste;3 medium sized ripe tomatoes, pureed;0.5 teaspoon coriander powder;0.5 teaspoon cumin powder;0.25 teaspoon turmeric powder;0.25 teaspoon chili powder or according to taste;2 tablespoons dry kasoori methi;2 tablespoons heavy cream, optional;0.5 teaspoon of Salt;15 fresh white button mushrooms;1 large green or red bell pepper, cubed;0.25 teaspoon turmeric;0.25 teaspoon chili powder, or to taste;0.25 cup whole Greek yogurt or strained yogurt;1 tablespoon oil'
column13: '1 Heat oil in a wok, and add the cumin seeds. When they begin to sizzle add the onion.;2 Cook on medium heat till onion is brown. Then add the ginger garlic paste and stir for about 45 seconds. ;3 Pour in the tomato puree and sprinkle the coriander, cumin, turmeric and chili powders.;4 Bring to a boil. Then reduce heat to a simmer, and let the gravy cook for about 12 minutes or till it thickens and oil floats on top.;5 Wipe the mushrooms clean with a paper towel.;6 Mix together the mushrooms, pepper, turmeric, chili powder, and yogurt and set side.;7 Heat a large skillet and add oil. Also add kasoori methi and sat. ;10 Cook on medium heat for about 3 minutes or till the peppers are cooked. Garnish with chopped cilantro.'

Add mustard, cumin and crushed coriander and cook for few seconds. ;2 The seeds will sizzle as they hit the oil.;3 Add the onions, jalapeno, garlic and ginger, mix and let cook for few minutes until onion is translucent and soft. ;4 Add the tomato and continue cooking for few minutes longer until mixture is cooked well and almost paste like.;5 Add the red pepper chili powder, turmeric , salt and four tablespoons of water and mix. column13: '1 Heat up a pot and saute the shallots until aromatic. ;2 Add the curry paste into the pot and do a few quick stirs. ;3 Add 1 1/2 cups water and bring it to boil. Then add the seafood, cover the pot until cooked. ;4 Add the coconut milk and salt to taste. Serve hot.'

column11: 'chicken;ginger paste;garlic paste;red chilly powder;ground black pepper;Salt;cooking oil;lime juice;lemon juice;food color;tomatoes;garlic paste;ginger paste;jalapeno;cinnamon piece;bay leaf;cloves;green cardamom;black pepper; ketchup; sugar;red chili powder;dried fenugreek leaves;Salt; cooking oil;butter;water'
column12: '2 lbs chicken (preferably thigh meat, boneless and skinless, cut into 2-3 inch pieces);2 teaspoons ginger paste;0.5 tablespoons garlic paste;1 teaspoons red chilly powder;0.5 teaspoon ground black pepper;0.5 teaspoon of Salt as per taste;3 tablespoon cooking oil;2 teaspoons lime/lemon juice;2 pinches of food color (deep orange, totally optional);4 large tomatoes, quartered;0.5 tablespoons garlic paste;2 teaspoons ginger paste;1 jalapeno;1 2-inch cinnamon piece;1 bay leaf;4 cloves;2 green cardamom;6 whole black pepper;2 tablespoons ketchup;2 teaspoon sugar;0.5 teaspoon red chili powder;0.5 teaspoon dried fenugreek leaves;0.5 teaspoon of Salt as per taste;2 tablespoons cooking oil;2 tablespoon butter;0.5 cup water'
column13: '1 Wash and thoroughly pat dry the chicken and put it in a large non-reactive bowl. ;2 Add all the ingredients and mix well to ensure all the chicken pieces are well coated. ;3 Cover and let the chicken marinate for minimum 30 minutes or overnight in the refrigerator.;4 When ready, heat about 1 tablespoon of oil in a large wok or a pan. ;5 Transfer the marinated chicken along with all the marinade to the wok, on medium-high heat cook the chicken till all the liquid has dried up and the chicken is cooked and starts to get brown on the surface. ;6 This will take about 10-15minutes. (You can also grill the chicken pieces);7 In a large pan heat 2 tablespoons oil and add green cardamoms, cloves, black peppercorns, bay leaf and cinnamon;8 sauté for 30-40 seconds. Now add ginger and garlic paste;9 stir fry everything for a minute or so. ;10 Finally add the cut tomatoes and jalapeno along with 1/2 cup of water. Cover the pan and reduce the heat to low, let everything cook for 5-7 minutes or till the tomatoes are soft and starts to breakdown. ;11 Remove the pan from the heat and let it cool. ;12 Once the tomato mixture has cooled down, remove all the whole spices (cardamom, bay leaf, cinnamon stick, cloves and black pepper) and discard. ;13 Now put the tomato mixture in a blender and make a puree.;14 Transfer the pureed tomatoes to a clean pan, add ketchup, sugar, red chili powder salt and dried fenugreek leaves and 1/2 cup of water. ;15 Let it simmer for 2-3 minutes on low heat. Keep stirring occasionally. Now add butter give a quick stir, let the sauce simmer on lowest heat for good 5-7 minutes, or until you can see the oil bubbles started to show in the sauce.;16 Once the sauce is done, add the cooked chicken pieces, let it simmer for another 5 minutes or so. Remove from the heat and transfer the dish to serving platter.;17 Top it with chopped cilantro and little heavy cream (optional), enjoy with choice of bread or rice!'

column11: 'chicken;tomato paste;Salt;pepper;oil;vinegar;dried red Chile peppers;cloves;garlic cloves;ginger, peeled;paprika powder;ground cinnamon;ground cumin;dry mustard;sugar'
column12: '1 whole chicken, cut up into 8 pieces and skin removed onion, chopped;1 tablespoon tomato paste;0.5 teaspoon of Salt as per taste;0.5 teaspoon of pepper as per taste;3 tablespoons oil;0.5 cup vinegar (white);4 dried red Chile peppers (you can use any moderately hot Chile and adjust the quantity as per you liking);4 cloves;8 garlic cloves, skin removed;1 2inch piece fresh ginger, peeled;1 teaspoon paprika powder;0.25 teaspoon ground cinnamon;0.5 teaspoon ground cumin;0.5 teaspoon dry mustard;1 teaspoon sugar'
column13: '1 Wash and pat dry the chicken pieces and keep aside in a large non-reactive bowl.;2 In another clean glass bowl add vinegar and soak all the ingredients needed for the spice blend for 15-20 minutes. ;3 Then blend these into a fine paste using a blender.;4 Add the spice mixture paste to the chicken and toss well to evenly coat all the chicken pieces. ;5 Let the chicken marinate for 4-6 hours.;6 In a large and deep skillet/wok heat the oil on medium heat. ;7 Add the marinated chicken and cook for 4-5 minutes. Stirring often.;8 Add the chopped onions, tomato paste, salt and pepper to the chicken. ;9 Give everything a good stir. Finally add 1/2 cup of water, cover the lid of the skillet and lower the heat to low. ;10 Let the chicken simmer on low for 15-20 minutes or till well done and the oil start to ooze from the curry.'

column12: '10 oz skinless and boneless chicken breast, cut into 1/2-inch cubes;1 tablespoon butter;2 cloves garlic, minced;1/2 jalapeno, deseeded;0.5 teaspoon of Salt to taste;1 12-inches store-bought pizza crust or three (3) 7-inches mini pizza crusts;1 teaspoon of Olive oil for brushing;0.25 onion, thinly sliced;1 cup mozzarella cheese;2 sprig of coriander leaves/cilantro, chopped, save some for garnish;0.5 teaspoon ground cumin;0.5 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper;0.5 teaspoon ground garam masala;0.5 teaspoon minced fresh ginger;0.25 teaspoon salt;0.25 teaspoon ground black pepper;1 tablespoon lemon juice;2 tablespoons plain yogurt;0.5 teasponn of cinnamon;4oz tomato sauce;2 tablespoons plain yogurt;2 tablespoons heavy cream;0.5 teaspoon cumin;0.5 teaspoon paprika;0.5 teaspoon garam masala'
column13: '1 In a bowl, marinade the chicken with the Marinade for at least an hour in the refrigerator.;2 Line a layer of aluminum foil in a baking pan for grilling. Spread the marinated chicken in a single layer on the pan, discard the remaining marinade. Grill the chicken at 450F for 6-7 minutes, turning at half time.;3 While the chicken is cooking, prepare the Tomato Sauce and Spice Mix in separate bowls. ;4 Remove the chicken from the pan when it is done and discard the juice.;5 Heat a small sauce pan and melt the butter. Sauté the garlic and jalapeno until aromatic. ;6 Pour in the Spice Mix and sauté until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes on medium heat. ;7 Remove the jalapeno and discard.;8 Add in the Tomato Sauce and stir well to mix. ;8 Sprinkle salt to taste and continue to simmer until the sauce thickens, another 2 minutes. ;9 Turn off the heat and add the chicken meat into the sauce and mix well.;10 Pre-heat the oven to 450F. Place the pizza crust on a pizza pan and brush lightly with olive oil. ;11 Spread the sauce/gravy on the pizza crust. Sprinkle 1/2 cup of cheese. Arrange the chicken on the pizza. Top it with the sliced onions, chopped cilantro and the remaining cheese.;12 Reduce the temperature to 425F. Bake the pizza for 8-10 minutes. ;13 Remove the pizza from the pan when is done and garnish the remaining chopped cilantro.'

column11: 'chicken;oil;garlic;ginger;onion;cumin seeds;green cardamom pods;tomato;turmeric;cayenne;salt;ground black pepper'
column12: '600g boneless, skinless chicken breast;4 tablespoons vegetable oil;1 tablespoon minced garlic;1 teaspoon peeled and finely grated fresh ginger;1 onion, grated on the largest grating holes on a box grater or shredded in a food processor;0.75 teaspoon cumin seeds;4 whole green cardamom pods;1 large fully ripe tomato, cut into 4 pieces;0.25 heaping teaspoon ground turmeric;0.75 teaspoon ground red pepper (cayenne);0.75 teaspoon salt;0.75 teaspoon ground black pepper'
column13: '1 Wash the chicken with cold water and cut into 3/4-inch (2-cm) pieces.;2 Pour the oil into a large skillet and place over medium heat. When the oil is heated, add the garlic, ginger and onion. Sauté until the onion is golden brown, stirring frequently, about 7 minutes.;3 Add the cumin seeds. Open the cardamoms and add the seeds and the pods. Stir to combine. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Add the tomato and cover the skillet. Cook until the tomato becomes completely soft and mashed and is combined with the onion to form a coarse paste, stirring every minute or so and lightly mashing the tomato, about 5 minutes.;4 Add the turmeric, red pepper, salt and black pepper. Stir to combine. Cook uncovered for 7 minutes, stirring frequently. This is the masala (spice base).;5 Add the chicken. Stir to combine and increase the heat to medium. Cook uncovered until there are no signs of pink when you insert a knife though the chicken, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes.;6 Remove the cardamom pods and discard. Enjoy now or let cool to room temperature and refrigerate or freeze for later!'

column12: '2 cups whole wheat flour (or stone ground drum-wheat also known as Atta);1 cup water (approximately);1 teaspoon salt;2g flour in a shallow plate or pie dish to help with coating and dusting while rolling the chapattis'
column13: '1 Sieve the flour, add salt to it and mix well. Place the flour in a large bowl and add ¾ cup of water. ;2 Stir lightly with fingers in a circular motion till the flour start to gather. ;3 Add 1-2 tablespoons of more flour if the dough looks too sticky or add little more water if it looks too dry and firm.;4 Knead the flour until you have soft and pliable dough that does not stick to your fingers. ;5 You can put little oil on your hand while kneading the dough to help with kneading. ;6 Cover with plastic wrap and let the dough rest for minimum 1 hour at room temperature. ;7 If keeping for longer period store the dough in refrigerator and make sure to bring it back to room temperature before using it.;8 Once ready to make chapatis, heat the griddle over medium-high heat. Divide the dough into 10-12 equal-sized balls and start working with each ball separately. ;9 Place the bowl in dry flour and flatten it a bit with help of finger tips. ;10 Transfer the flatten ball to any clean flat surface and with help of rolling pin, roll it into approx. ;11 6-7 inch circle of uniform thickness. While rolling the chapati if the dough sticks to the rolling surface, dust it and the surface lightly with little flour.;12 Place the rolled chapati on the hot griddle and cook for 30 seconds or until tiny golden dots appear on the bottom, flip over to the other side. ;13 Once the other side is also covered with larger brown dots, turn it over again. Soon the chapati will start to puff up. ;14 With the help of a folded kitchen towel press gently on the puffed part, gently pushing the air to the flatten part of chapati until the whole chapati puffs up into a round ball (don’t get disheartened if your chapati doesn’t puff up like a ball, it will still taste as delicious as the puffed on. ;15 It may take a little practice to get perfectly puffed chapatis). You can puff up the chapati on direct flame too.;16 Transfer the cooked chapatis to the plate, if you want to baste it with little butter or ghee and serve hot.'

column12: '500g ripe but firm green mango;1 sticks cinnamon (about 2 inch);2 whole cloves;1 teaspoon cumin seeds;1 teaspoon coriander seeds;2 cardamom pods, cracked;1 teaspoon ginger, grated;3 whole dry red chilly;1 clove garlic, crushed;0.75 cup demerara sugar;0.5 cup vinegar;0.75 cup water;1 teaspoon salt'
column13: '1 Cut the mango into 1 inch cubes and for chunky chutney, keep some pieces about 2 inch.  ;2 If you are looking for smooth, cut them all in same size.;3 Using a piece of thin muslin cloth, tie up the spices into a bundle. Cook the mango, spices (in the muslin cloth), water, ginger and garlic until the mango is tender. ;4 Some pieces will disintegrate into the water. Takes about 10 minutes.;5 Add the vinegar, sugar, salt and dry chilies. ;6 The sugar requirement may also vary depending on the sweetness of your mango and personal preference. ;7 Cook for about 30 -35 minutes until the chutney is thickened. ;8 Squeeze every bit you can from the cloth and discard it. ;8 Transfer to sterilized jars while still hot. ;9 Don’t put the lid, until the chutney cools. ;10 It keeps well for 4 weeks in the refrigerator.'

column12: '60 g almonds;100 g icing sugar;50 g aged egg whites;20 g caster sugar;0.5 teaspoon of pink food colouring powder;0.5 teaspoon of rose essence;50 g caster sugar;50 ml water;2  egg yolks  ;125 g butter;2 tablespoons canned lychee'
column13: 'Line a large baking tray with baking sheet or silicon sheet (preferably).;Using a round cookie cutter, press it into some cocoa powder or flour.;Use the cookie cutter to make some round imprint on the silicon sheet and set aside.;Sift icing sugar and almond together and set aside.;Whisk egg whites in a clean, dry bowl till soft peaks form.; Add caster sugar, pink food colouring, rose essence and continue whisking till glossy.; Fold in ground almond and icing sugar mixture by hand, adding it in one third at a time.; Mix until well combined.;Spoon batter into a piping bag with a plain nozzle and pipe it within the round imprint you made earlier, leaving 2cm spaces in between each macaron.;Let the macarons rest for 30minutes in a well chilled room.;Preheat oven to 150 degrees.;Bake one tray at a time for 12-15 minutes, depending on individual oven.;Remove macarons and cool on a wire rack.; (if you have difficulty removing the shell, spray a little mist under baking sheet. Let it sit for a few sec and peel it off.);Buttercream:;Drain canned lychees on a paper towel and finely chop them up.; Set aside.;Place sugar and water in a small saucepan and cook on low heat till sugar dissolves.; Turn up heat and boil until sugar reaches a soft ball stage (test by dropping some syrup into a bowl of ice water, it should form a soft ball if pressed together).;Beat egg yolks in a small mixing bowl, adding in hot syrup in a steady stream.; Continue whisking until yolks become pale in colour and are no longer warm.;Add 2-3 tablespoons of butter at a time, beating until creamy.;Use half the buttercream and mix with the chopped lychee.; One buttercream recipe is good for two macaron recipes.;Fill the buttercream into a piping bag and snip off the ends.;Pipe buttercream onto a macaron shell and top with another to close it, pressing lightly to distribute the buttercream.;Store in containers lined with greaseproof paper.;To ;age; egg whites, put egg white in a container and store in the fridge for three days before use.; Aged egg whites contain less moisture than fresh ones and can hold their shape better.'

column13: 'Peel and chop the onion roughly, about two cups.;Peel and slice turmeric and galangal and place in the food processor.;Add the chilly and lemongrass, cut into short lengths.;Wash the candlenuts and add to the bowl, together with the belachan.;Process till you get a rough paste.;Heat 2-3 tablespoons vegetable oil in a wok and when hot, sautÃ© garlic and onion.;When caramelised, add the spice paste.;Fry paste over a small fire till fragrant and oil rises to the surface.;Sprinkle a little water from time to time to ensure the paste does not burn.;Add chicken pieces to brown.;Then add a cup of water and turn down fire to cook, covered, till tender.;The chicken should release its own juices as well, but you can add another cup of water if it seems too dry, bearing in mind that this is a dry curry.;After about 15 minutes, add coconut milk to the wok and bring back to the boil, stirring all the time.;Season to taste with salt, sugar and pepper to taste.;Serve garnished with fried shallots and garlic and fresh kaffir lime leaves.'

column13: 'Heat enough oil for deep-frying in a large wok over medium high heat.;Rinse the chicken pieces thoroughly and place in a large mixing bowl.;Sprinkle all the spices evenly all over the chicken, rubbing gently into the skin.;Allow the chicken to sit for 10 minutes.;Deep-fry the chicken a few pieces at a time, as many as the wok will allow without overcrowding.;Cook on each side for approximately 5 to 6 minutes.;Larger pieces such as breasts may require longer cooking times.;Drain the cooked pieces on paper towels before transferring to a serving plate.;Melt the butter in a small saucepan over high heat and stir in 1 teaspoon of garlic powder and 1 teaspoon of salt until thoroughly mixed.;Drizzle the melted butter over the fried chicken just before serving.'
